results.title: Swarm
results.brief_description:
Sound and image projection specifically commissioned for Eyes Lies and Illusions in 2006.

Swarm, in the tradition of the phantasmagoria, hides the technology by which its effects are created. Multiple projections, motion sensors and speakers create the sense that the gallery is inhabited by insects, which emerge from a throbbing hive in a dark corner of the building to fly across the displays or swoop around visitors to the gallery. The work is unable to be seen in its entirety from any one place, it has no frame, no apparent beginning nor end. The bugs are free to move through the gallery space, just as we are. Swarm reacts to our presence, yet is beyond our control.

results.title: Plug-in. Episode 2
results.creator_credit: Salvador Castro, Simon Moule and C31 Melbourne
results.brief_description: Aired 07 April 2005. Plug-in is a fifteen minute television program that aired weekly on channel 31 in 2005 (season 2 scheduled from July 2006) . Each fifteen minutes consisted of a major and minor documentary as well as a vox pop montage relating to the major piece. Within this framework a broad range of material is presented, from profiles of the day-to-day workings of community organizations to documentaries and political animation. Plug-in presents material on indigenous rights and reconciliation, migrant issues, environment, education, health, culture, arts and dissent. In 2005 Plug In TV won 2 Antenna Awards (Australian Community Television Awards) for best editing, and best sound and was nominated for best show of the year.

results.title: Twelve tuff tales
results.brief_description:
Twelve students from Grade 6 at Carlton Primary School create their own individual story about a “bad day” from their own perspective. Some examples of the stories include getting chased by snarling dogs in the park, falling over and ruining a new pair of jeans, losing a kid sister at the shops and getting lost in Safeways.
The children involved in making this collection of one-minute works were mostly refugee children who live on an inner Melbourne housing estate and speak English as a second language.
“Twelve tuff tales” was created as a school-based multimedia production and funded by an Arts and Culture grant from the City of Melbourne. It was produced at Artplay: the centre for contemporary arts for children.
The stories include:
1. Bandaids by Abir Musa
2. The Horrible day by Dunya Ahmen
3. Bullies at the park by Hashem Alhassan
4. Lost by Hodan Yusuf
5. Feeding the fishes by JD Bautista
6. Blown away by Meriam Abubeker
7. Untitled - no credits
8. Two big dogs with sharp teeth by Mustafa Housain
9. Untitled - no credits
10. The Shower by Sadam Ahmed
11. Grounded by Thao Le
12. Lost in High Point by Shukri Ismail

results.title: Egg
results.creator_credit: Nicole Mitchell, Anne Gilhooly and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
An elderly woman living alone in her suburban family home makes a friend - a fallen bird’s egg she finds in the local park. She takes Egg into her home, and into her heart.
A sensual and evocative film about lonliness, life and love.
Features Paulette Perry as the woman.

results.title: Bound
results.creator_credit: Serhat Caradee, Daniella Ortega and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A boy, a dead body, a relentless pursuit â€“ itâ€™s not what you see, itâ€™s how you see it.
Bound is an urban tragedy about a boy who is mistakenly shot by the police. Jumping back and forth in time to reveal instincts colliding and lives unravelling in a world that rushes on regardless, this film is about what happens when you make all the wrong decisions for the right reasons.

results.title: Bidja
results.creator_credit: Bidja Atkinson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Of Yorta Yorta descent, Bidja Atkinson talks about his love for the bush and his life living just outside of Echuca with his family of artists and musicians.

results.title: [Untitled segment on NAIDOC day: Access News 2000]
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV
results.brief_description: A look at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Day of Celebration. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Thugs of the Forest
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV
results.brief_description: An expose of the attack on Goolengook protesters who were ambushed in the middle of the night by a group of angry foresters.Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
